sentences.en: A handful of displaced residents were allowed in to scrounge through rubble for their belongings.
sentences.cn: 少数已迁移的居民被允许进入,到废墟中搜寻他们的财物.

sentences.en: Can I scrounge a cigarette off you?
sentences.cn: 我可以向你讨一支烟 吗 ?

sentences.en: Can you scrounge up some new furniture?
sentences.cn: 你能弄到一些新家具 吗 ?

sentences.en: Don't scrounge my pen without my allowance!
sentences.cn: 我不允许,你不能擅自拿我的钢笔用!

sentences.en: He was sleeping under old houses and eating what little he could scrounge.
sentences.cn: 他睡在破旧屋檐下,吃着乞讨来的那一丁点东西.

sentences.en: I managed to scrounge the materials to build a shed.
sentences.cn: 我设法弄来点材料搭个棚子.

sentences.en: I will carry no more. You may scrounge what I have dropped upon the ground.
sentences.cn: 维康妮亚:我带不了那么多物品. 你可以捡回我丢在地上的东西.

sentences.en: She has a job now, but still goes back to her parents'house to scrounge food.
sentences.cn: 她已经工作了, 可是还去父母家蹭饭吃.

sentences.en: She's always on the scrounge for cigarettes. Why doesn't she buy her own?
sentences.cn: 她总向人讨要香烟, 为什么自己不买 呢 ?

sentences.en: The station director had to scrounge some records.
sentences.cn: 这样,电台台长就不得不四处寻找唱片来播出.

sentences.en: We managed to scrounge every piece of gear you requested.
sentences.cn: 我们设法要来了你要求的每一件用具。

sentences.en: Williams had to scrounge enough money to get his car out of the car park.
sentences.cn: 威廉斯不得不讨来足够的钱把车开出停车场。

phrases.tran_cn: (英)从事乞讨骗取（或偷窃）的活动

trans.tran_en: to be trying to get money or things you want by asking other people for them
to get money or something you want by asking other people for it rather than by paying for it yourself
